Title: Bank python
Notes: Simple & accessible interfaces for everything. Seemingly the anti-thesis of clean code

Title: How Notion Scaled to 100 Million Users Without Their Database Exploding
Notes: Doubling down on Postgres, scaling horizontally using shards and pgbouncer

Title: Brendan Gregg: The Speed of Time
Notes: Flamegraphs discovers reading current time took longer on Ubuntu than CentOS

Title: How Instagram Reduced Web Page Load by 50%
Notes: Many optimization patterns for front-end, from HTTP transportation, to asset fetching order, to caching locally (and avoiding conflicts with new state updates)

Title: How Instagram Scaled to 14 Million Users With Only 3 Engineers
Notes: Postgres: pgbouncer, ID strategy for finding correct shard, (stateless) Django, Gearman, etc.

Title: Java Pattern: Algebraic Data Types
Notes: Using the visitor pattern to mimic ADT in a relatively readable manner, despite Java™

Title: Unix and Google
Notes: 'Coding at the perimiter', an approach to tackle the n^3 matrix of system ✕ feature ✕ platform - write programs that work together (pipes, everything-is-a-file, etc.). Examplifies with Multics vs UNIX

Title: Using A Genetic Algorithm For Table Seating
Notes: A solver with an interesting UI: choose between a timeout or a certain number of generations

Title: War rooms vs. deep investigations
Notes: A debugging journey lasting a couple of weeks, of a Facebook crash
